verb.description: Further the progress of (something, especially a cause, venture, or aim); support or actively encourage.
examples: some regulation is still required to promote competition

verb.description: Advance or raise (someone) to a higher position or rank.
examples: she was promoted to General Manager

verb.description: Act as a promoter of (a catalyst).

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin promot- moved forward, from the verb promovere, from pro- forward, onward + movere to move.
